recipe.title: Quick fish curry
recipe.description: Looking for a cheap, healthy weeknight dinner? This speedy fish curry is a total winner. Using pantry staples, it’s ready in just 15 minutes.

ingredients.name: ½ a bunch of fresh coriander
heaped tablespoons tikka masala curry paste

steps.descr: Place the rice in a 24cm non-stick frying pan with the...
steps.instructions: Place the rice in a 24cm non-stick frying pan with the cloves, 600ml of boiling water and a pinch of sea salt. Boil for 10 minutes, then cover and reduce to a low heat for 5 minutes, or until the base is golden and crispy and the rice is fluffy.

on_enter.say: Place the rice in a 24cm non-stick frying pan with the cloves, 600ml of boiling water and a pinch of sea salt. Boil for 10 minutes, then cover and reduce to a low heat for 5 minutes, or until the base is golden and crispy and the rice is fluffy.

steps.descr: Peel and roughly chop the onion
steps.instructions: Peel and roughly chop the onion. Pick the coriander leaves into a bowl of iced water, and finely chop the stalks.

on_enter.say: Peel and roughly chop the onion. Pick the coriander leaves into a bowl of iced water, and finely chop the stalks.

steps.descr: Place a large pan on a high heat with 1 tablespoon of...
steps.instructions: Place a large pan on a high heat with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, add the onion and coriander stalks, fry for 1 minute, then add the curry paste and fry for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.

on_enter.say: Place a large pan on a high heat with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, add the onion and coriander stalks, fry for 1 minute, then add the curry paste and fry for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.

steps.descr: Push the onion to one side, then tip the tomatoes into...
steps.instructions: Push the onion to one side, then tip the tomatoes into the other, breaking them up with a spoon. Leave to blip away for 5 minutes, stirring the onions occasionally, then stir everything together to make a sauce. Add the fish and stir again to coat.

on_enter.say: Push the onion to one side, then tip the tomatoes into the other, breaking them up with a spoon. Leave to blip away for 5 minutes, stirring the onions occasionally, then stir everything together to make a sauce. Add the fish and stir again to coat.

steps.descr: Break in the beans, tear in half the coriander leaves,...
steps.instructions: Break in the beans, tear in half the coriander leaves, then tip in half the coconut milk and bring back to a simmer.

on_enter.say: Break in the beans, tear in half the coriander leaves, then tip in half the coconut milk and bring back to a simmer.

steps.descr: Stir in the honey, then cook for a final 5 minutes, or...
steps.instructions: Stir in the honey, then cook for a final 5 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the fish is flaky and cooked through, stirring occasionally.

on_enter.say: Stir in the honey, then cook for a final 5 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the fish is flaky and cooked through, stirring occasionally.

steps.descr: Ripple the remaining coconut milk through the sauce, and...
steps.instructions: Ripple the remaining coconut milk through the sauce, and tear over the remaining coriander leaves, then turn out the rice cake and serve up.

on_enter.say: Ripple the remaining coconut milk through the sauce, and tear over the remaining coriander leaves, then turn out the rice cake and serve up.
